Literature Review: The CYBATHLON competition, which began in 2016, has emerged as a significant catalyst for advancing assistive technologies (ATs) designed to improve the lives of individuals with disabilities. With approximately 1.1 billion people worldwide living with some form of disability, the need for effective and user-friendly ATs is paramount (World Health Organization, 2021). However, the development of these technologies often fails to adequately consider the perspectives and needs of end users, leading to frustration and non-adoption of available devices (Mihailidis et al., 2008). The CYBATHLON aims to address this gap by fostering a more user-centered approach to the development of ATs, thereby enhancing their practicality and usability in real-world settings.
